content:
The Act titled "Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2002" authorizes additional projects under the Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000. The Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 is amended to include specific projects in various irrigation districts in Texas, such as pipeline and pumping system in United Irrigation District of Hidalgo County, proposed improvements to Canal C in Cameron County Irrigation District No. 2, and water conservation projects in Delta Lake Irrigation District of Hidalgo and Willacy Counties. Proposed water conservation projects in various Texas counties include salvaging spill water in Irrigation District No. 9, main canal replacement in Brownsville Irrigation District, off-district pump station project in Irrigation District No. 16, and canal replacement in Irrigation District No. 1. These projects were identified in engineering reports dated February 14, 2001. Proposed water conservation projects in Texas counties include a canal replacement in the North Branch East Main, an improvement project in Donna Irrigation District, a water quality project in Hudspeth County, and a canal improvement project in El Paso County. The Riverside Canal Improvement Project Phase I Reach A, Maverick County Main Canal lining project, Hidalgo County Irrigation District No. 6 rehabilitation, and Hidalgo County Irrigation District No. 2 Wisconsin Canal Improvements are identified water conservation projects in Texas. Greenwood & Associates, Inc. engineering report from February 2001 mentions improvements in Hidalgo County, Texas Irrigation District No. 2 Lateral 'A' Canal as identified in a previous report from July 25, 2001. SEC. 3. AMENDMENTS TO THE LOWER RIO GRANDE VALLEY WATER RESOURCES CONSERVATION AND IMPROVEMENT ACT OF 2000. The Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 is amended to include a program under cooperative agreements by the Bureau of Reclamation, project proposals review guidelines, and additional provisions for operation and maintenance. The Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 is amended to include provisions for operation, maintenance, repair, and replacement. Section 3 is amended to update criteria and guidelines, adjust the federal share of cost preparation, and increase the funding limit. Section 4 is amended to clarify project cost and construction details. Section 4(c) of the Lower Rio Grande Valley Water Resources Conservation and Improvement Act of 2000 is amended to increase the funding limit from "$10,000,000" to "$47,000,000 (2001 dollars)".
